section_title: Emissions from international aviation and maritime transport
sentences: This issue (FCCC/SBSTA/2011/MISC.5) was first taken up by the SBSTA plenary on 10 June.
Parties heard reports from the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) and the International Maritime Organization (IMO).

Cuba, for a number of developing countries, with Bolivia, Iran and Kenya, for the African Group, emphasized that actions to address bunker fuels should be guided by the principle of common but differentiated responsibilities and that any market mechanisms in these sectors contradicting this principle would increase costs and affect trade.

He expressed concern with the IMO s proposal to develop revenue streams for addressing climate change, while Japan, the US, Australia, the Russian Federation, South Africa, the Cook Islands and Panama supported the work of the IMO and ICAO to reduce emissions.
The EU supported discussing the issue under the AWG-LCA.
The SBSTA adopted conclusions on 16 June.
